channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why do so many people ring in the new year on Jan. 1?
item.description: Much of the world follows the Gregorian calendar, named after Pope Gregory XIII, who put the finishing touches on a Roman system that integrated ideas...

item.title: A 'very aesthetic person,' President Trump says being a builder is his second job
item.description: President Trump was a builder before he took office, but he has continued it as a hobby in the White House.

item.title: Electric vehicles had a bumpy road in 2025 — and one pleasant surprise
item.description: A suite of pro-EV federal policies have been reversed. Well-known vehicles have been discontinued. Sales plummeted. But interest is holding steady.

item.title: Teens are having disturbing interactions with chatbots. Here's how to lower the risks
item.description: Teen use of AI chat bots is growing, and psychologists worry it's affecting their social development and mental health. Here's what parents should kno...

item.title: 'Raising questions' isn't enough. The best films of the year took a stance
item.description: Now is not the time for subtlety, nostalgia or neutrality on screen.

item.title: John Simpson: 'I've reported on 40 wars but I've never seen a year like 2025'
item.description: It has been a year of multiple major conflicts - and there are geopolitical implications of unparalleled importance

item.title: Trump says progress made in Ukraine talks but 'thorny issues' remain
item.description: Both the US president and Zelensky describe talks in Florida as "great" and "terrific" but the issue of territory remains "unresolved".

item.title: Mine in South Korean to offer U.S. new source of a critical war metal
item.description: China dominates the supply of critical minerals such as tungsten, but a U.S. push for alternative sources has found one, deep inside a South Korean mo...

item.title: Bondi Beach shooting hero says he just wanted to save innocent people
item.description: Ahmed al Ahmed, the man hailed as a hero for disarming one of the gunmen behind a deadly antisemitic attack on Australia's Bondi Beach, says he just w...

item.title: Thailand accuses Cambodia of breaking newly signed ceasefire deal
item.description: The ceasefire took effect at noon local time (05:00 GMT) on Saturday.

item.title: 'There are many challenges': Syrians in Turkey consider return after fall of Assad
item.description: Syrians in Turkey are weighing up whether it is the right time to return to their homeland.

item.title: China launches 2 days of live-fire military drills around Taiwan
item.description: China launched live-fire drills around Taiwan that it said would simulate a blockade of the self-ruled island's key ports, prompting Taipei to condemn...

item.title: 12/28: CBS Weekend News
item.description: Helicopters collide above New Jersey; Another massive storm snarling travel.

item.title: China holds military drills around Taiwan as warning to 'separatist forces'
item.description: The drills come days after the US announced the sale of one of its largest weapons packages to Taiwan.

item.title: Train accident in southern Mexico leaves at least 13 dead and dozens injured
item.description: Officials said a train accident in southern Mexico killed at least 13 people and injured dozens, halting traffic along a rail line connecting the Paci...

item.title: The moon and sun figure big in the new year’s lineup of cosmic wonders
Midair helicopter crash in New Jersey leaves 1 dead and another critically injured
item.description: Officials say two helicopters have crashed midair in southern New Jersey on Sunday, killing one person and leaving another critically injured.

item.title: New York subway ends its MetroCard era and switches fully to tap-and-go fares
